data.title: History of Rubeling & Associates
data.meta_description: History of Rubeling & Associates - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Rubeling & Associates, Inc. Architecture | Interior Design | Master Planning | Historic Architecture Celebrating 25 + Years

2. 1981 - 1983 August 1, 1981 Albert W. Rubeling, Jr., AIA opens his own firm at 319 York Road in Towson. November, 1982 John J. DiMenna, AIA joins the firm. 1983 The firm begins its 18-year relationship with Maryland National Bank, now Bank of America. Design starts for VA Medical Center at Fort Howard. 1983 One Shawan Place is completed. September, 1983 Rubeling & Associates moves to 5 East Pennsylvania Avenue in Towson with six employees. One Shawan Place 1981 - 1983 VA Medical Center at Fort Howard

3. 1984 - 1985 September, 1984 David P. Recchia, AIA joins the firm. 1984 University Plaza office building is designed. The first project for Cellular One is completed. 1985 Rubeling & Associates completes its first project for the Archdiocese of Baltimore, a handicapped ramp at St. Ursula’s Church in Parkville. August, 1985 Mitch Nelson, CSI joins the firm. University Plaza 1984-1985 St. Ursula’s Church

4. 1986 Rubeling & Associates moves its offices to 530 East Joppa Road. Rubeling & Associates begins design of Harvest Office Building in Timonium. Multi-purpose addition is designed for Christ the King Episcopal Church. Harvest Office Building Miles & Stockbridge December The firm is contracted to provide interior renovation design for the 5-level, 85,000 square foot offices of Miles & Stockbridge, headquartered in Baltimore. 1986

5. 1987 Interior Design is added as a professional service. The firm designs ten Red Robin restaurants from New York to Florida. 1988 Essex Community College Childcare Center project is completed. Al Rubeling serves as President of the Baltimore Chapter AIA. Essex Community College Childcare Center Red Robin Restaurant 1987-1988

6. 1988 Rubeling & Associates breaks ground and completes the construction of its two-story office building in Towson. Groundbreaking Ceremony Towsontowne Boulevard View Studio Jefferson Avenue View 1988

7. 1989 Rubeling & Associates begins 12-year relationship with St. James Academy. The firm begins eight-year project to upgrade life safety features at the Maryland National Bank high-rise at 10 Light Street. John DiMenna is appointed to Baltimore County Architectural Review Board. 1989 Maryland National Bank Our Lady of Grace Al Rubeling serves as President of Maryland Society AIA. March Groundbreaking takes place for Our Lady of Grace Church in Monkton. St. James Academy

8. 1990 - 1991 1991 The firm survives the recession by designing the National Cryptological School for NSA. Staff size reduces from 17 to 8. November, 1991 Parish Center at St. Peter the Apostle Church is completed in Libertytown. St. Francis de Sales Church St. Peter the Apostle Parish Center 1990 AIA/CEC Peer Review commends the firm’s in-house scheduling and quality control system. March, 1990 Al Rubeling is appointed by Governor William Donald Schaefer to the State Board of Architects. 1991 St. Francis de Sales Church, Abingdon is completed. June, 1991 Jim Mills, AIA joins the firm. September, 1991 Library addition for Holy Family Parish School is completed. National Cryptological School 1990-1991

9. 1992 - 1993 1992 Essex Community College Library alteration project is completed. Al Rubeling serves on the National Board of Directors for the AIA. June, 1993 Albert W. Rubeling, Jr. becomes a Fellow in the American Institute of Architects. Essex Community College December, 1993 Al Rubeling’s book, “How to Start and Operate Your Own Design Firm” is published by McGraw-Hill. September, 1993 Robin Nikiel, IIDA joins the firm. October, 1992 Rubeling & Associates receives a Small Business Award from Baltimore County Economic Development. 1993 Design award is received from Baltimore Magazine for Goose Hollow. Baltimore County Public Safety Building project is completed $1 million under budget. Baltimore County Public Safety Building Fellowship in the AIA 1992-1993

10. 1994 - 1995 1994 John DiMenna serves as AIA Baltimore Chapter President. January, 1994 John DiMenna, AIA becomes Partner. May, 1994 Sue Rocco joins the firm. 1995 John DiMenna starts his four-year term as Director of the Maryland Society AIA. March, 1995 22 West Road receives Craftsmanship Award from the Building Congress and Exchange and a BOMA award. September, 1995 Diane Stahl joins the firm. October, 1995 Nathalie Smith joins the firm. 22 West Road 1994-1995

11. 1996 Total Health Care Division Street project is completed in Baltimore. St. Timothy’s Church in Walkersville is completed. The project wins a Masonry Institute award. 1996 Total Health Care St. Timothy’s Church

12. 1996 1996 July Sean Mackey joins the firm. Design begins on the Franklin Middle School addition. Design begins on the Catonsville High School addition in Baltimore County. Design begins on Heaver Plaza II. Cellular One Mapping Room is completed. January Ingrid Monse, AIA joins the firm. Cellular One Mapping Room Heaver Plaza II

13. 1997 - 1998 March, 1997 Katie Kayser joins the firm. November, 1997 Rubeling & Associates wins First Place Chairman’s Award at Festival of Trees. Festival of Trees Harley Davidson 1998 Harley Davidson of Baltimore retail store is completed. Al Rubeling serves as Chairman of the National AIA Convention in San Francisco. 1997-1998

14. 1998 1998 November South Shore Elementary School in Anne Arundel County receives commendation from American School & University magazine. South Shore Elementary School Dunbar Armored Express office building is completed. David Recchia, AIA becomes Partner. Dunbar Armored Express

15. 1999 Interior design is completed for Colliers Pinkard headquarters in Baltimore. Exterior enhancements to the Towson branch of Baltimore County Public Library are completed. 1999 February Kristen Keller joins the firm. May Addition to Franklin Middle School in Baltimore County is completed. Catonsville High School addition is completed. Colliers Pinkard Franklin Middle School Baltimore County Public Library Catonsville High School

16. 1999 1999 November The Henry J. Knott Performing Arts Center at Notre Dame Preparatory School is completed. Pamela Wright joins the firm. December Sandy Sawicki, ASID joins the firm. City Sand Contest Notre Dame Preparatory School Design begins on School of the Incarnation in Anne Arundel County for the Archdiocese of Baltimore. July Rubeling & Associates participates in City Sand contest at the Inner Harbor. School of the Incarnation

17. 2000 January St. Joseph’s Manor, an assisted living facility for the Josephites, is completed. February Jim Mills, AIA rejoins the firm. Amy Zeigenfuse joins the firm. Cathedral of Mary Our Queen Parish Center St. Joseph’s Manor Cathedral of Mary Our Queen Parish Center project is completed. March Rubeling & Associates opens its Frederick, Maryland office. Opening of Rubeling & Associates’ Frederick Office 2000

18. 2000 Design/build program is completed for Maryland Fire and Rescue Institute at University of Maryland, College Park. Preliminary design begins for Rosemont Elementary School addition in Montgomery County. Interior renovations for St. John the Evangelist Church in Frederick are completed. International Youth Foundation lobby renovation is completed in Baltimore. November Chi Yan joins the firm. December Susie Cunningham joins the firm. International Youth Foundation St. John the Evangelist 2000

19. 2001 Atlantic Builders Group headquarters is completed. Henry W. Jenkins Funeral Home in Hereford is designed. Sparks Corporate Center January Melissa Beach joins the firm. MariaGiovanna Galasso joins the firm’s Frederick office. Atlantic Builders Group Henry W. Jenkins Funeral Home FLS Automation U.S. Headquarters is designed for P. F. Obrecht. 2001

20. St. Ignatius Church in Hickory is under construction. Multiple interior design projects are completed at Fountainhead Country Club in Hagerstown. February Rebecca Arnold joins the firm. July Chidambar Didgikar joins the firm. Approval is received for design of the new Marley Elementary School in Anne Arundel County. 2001 St. Ignatius Church Owen Brown Interfaith Center in Columbia is in design. September Rodney Nesbitt joins the firm. Master Plans are in process for Our Lady of Grace, Immaculate Conception Parish, and the Franciscan Friars’ Cupertino. Owen Brown Interfaith Center 2001

21. 2002 School of the Incarnation in Anne Arundel County is completed. Interior renovations of Center for Pain Management locations in Hagerstown and Baltimore are completed. St. Ignatius Church is recognized with four Craftsmanship Awards by Building Congress and Exchange. Glenelg Country School Wylie Funeral Home is in design. Glenelg Country School gymnasium and classroom addition is in design. Bill Novian joins the firm. Aska Broda returns to the firm. Jonathan Miller joins the firm. Marilyn Gould joins the firm. Terry Stahlman joins the firm. Wylie Funeral Home School of the Incarnation 2002

22. 2003 Sports & Fitness Center for Notre Dame Preparatory School is in design. Heather McPherson joins the firm. Brian Minnich, AIA joins the firm. The new Seven Oaks Elementary School is approved for design. Historic Fort Garrison and Beatty-Cramer Spring House projects are completed. Interior alterations at Northrop Grumman are completed. The new White Marsh branch for Baltimore County Employees Federal Credit Union is completed. Seven Oaks Elementary School NDP Athletic & Fitness Center 2003 Baltimore County Employees Federal Credit Union Fort Garrison Before After After Before Beatty Cramer Spring House

23. 2004 Ss. Peter and Paul Church Maryland Transportation Authority Police Training Facility Borders Learning Center at Mount Saint Mary’s University in Emmitsburg is completed. 2004 Addition and renovations at Maryland Transportation Authority Key Bridge and new Police Training Facility locations are in design. Joni Abruzzese joins the firm. Rebecca Alsop joins the firm. Saints Peter and Paul Church in Easton is in design. Borders Learning Center

24. 2004 2004 Interior renovation is underway for the 42,000 sf operations expansion building for the Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association. Renovations to Archbishop Curley High School are complete. Nathalie Smith returns to the firm. Lauren Minnich joins the Frederick office. Interior renovation of the Injured Workers’ Insurance Fund headquarters is in design. Injured Workers’ Insurance Fund Archbishop Curley High School Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association

25. 2005 Hockessin Athletic Center Boys’ Latin School of Maryland The Boys’ Latin School of Maryland Duncan S. Smith Field is complete. Prologue headquarters is complete. Raja Kundu joins the firm. Brandon Weirich joins the firm. Hockessin Athletic Center is in design. 2005 Prologue

26. 2005 Glenelg Country School Notre Dame Preparatory School Sports & Fitness Center is complete. Valerie Ramirez joins the firm. Donal Fagan, AIA joins the Frederick office. Megan Elcrat joins the firm. 2005 New Towson Location NDP Athletic & Fitness Center Glenelg Country School gym and annex addition project is complete. Rubeling & Associates moves its Towson operation to Suite 500 at 1104 Kenilworth Drive.

27. 2005 2005 The firm celebrates the start of its 25 th year in business.

28. 2006 Oldfields Country School The renovation and additions for St. Mary’s School in Annapolis are in design. Emily McLellan joins the firm. Crystal Smith joins the firm. Atlantic Coast Athletic Club is completed. Atlantic Coast Athletic Club The Master Plan for Oldfields School is completed. 2006

29. 2006 St. John the Evangelist Church in Hydes, MD interior renovation is completed. Rosemont Elementary School 2006 Rehoboth Beach Pavilion St. John the Evangelist, Hydes Rehoboth Beach Pavilion is renovated and in use again. Rosemont Elementary School additions are completed. Wachovia Bank Training Center in Baltimore is in design.

30. 2007 Multiple new stores for Music & Arts Centers have been designed in Arizona, Texas, North Carolina, and South Carolina. Randallstown Community Center goes “green” with LEED ® design and construction goal for certification. Randallstown Community Center 2007 Plantation Isle Condominiums Plantation Isle Condominiums are under construction in South Carolina. The renovation of St. Ignatius historic church is in design. Kristen Gerding joins the firm.

31. 2007 IWIF renovation is completed. MdTA Training Facility is redesigned to include “green” features. St. Anne’s Episcopal Church, Middletown, Delaware, Master Plan is completed. Baltimore Country Club Tennis Facility is completed. Karen Williams joins the firm. Pikesville Library and Senior Center 2007 Injured Workers’ Insurance Fund (IWIF) Pikesville Library & Senior Center addition opens with rave reviews. Mt. St. Joseph High School stadium and field are under construction. Mt. St. Joseph High School Stadium

32. 2008 Harold Leo, CSI, AIA joins the firm. Adriano Lombre joins the firm. Forrest Popkin joins the firm. The five-part renovation, addition, and new middle school project for The Boys’ Latin School of Maryland is in design. St. Peter the Apostle, Libertytown 2008 The renovated and expanded St. Peter the Apostle Church, once destroyed by fire, is dedicated on September 7, 2008. The 40,000 sf interior fitout of PSA Financial Headquarters is completed. The Boys’ Latin School of Maryland

33. 2008 The historic restoration / preservation / recreation of Perry Hall Mansion, Old Towson Women’s Jail, and Banneker Cabin in Baltimore County are in design. St. Mary’s Ryken High School Campus Master Plan is completed. St. Timothy’s Church Parish Center is completed. Pasadena Elementary School St. Christopher’s Church, Kent Island The new Pasadena Elementary School for Anne Arundel County is opened. St. Christopher’s Church on Kent Island is completed. St. Timothy’s Church and Parish Center 2008
